content:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.NARRATIVE DESIGN LEAD (Hybrid)  
 
ABOUT FIREWALK STUDIOS 
Firewalk Studios is dedicated to creating unforgettable multiplayer experiences that capture the joy of playing together. We believe in the power of multiplayer and want to delight players with worlds that spark imagination and forge connection through immersive gameplay, artistry, and heartfelt characters. We are currently working on an original multiplayer game as part of Sony Interactive Entertainment.
Creating worlds that ignite imagination and connection takes a collaborative team. Firewalk is building a world-class, next-generation game studio with a focus on a more sustainable approach to game development. For us, setting a high-quality bar, creating something extraordinary, and treating each other with trust and respect go hand-in-hand.  
THE ROLE
Firewalk Studios is looking for a Narrative Design Lead who is interested in applying their skills to help bring exceptional entertainment to millions of players. As our Narrative Design Lead, you’ll be joining a very special team in a unique place in the development process. We’re a new IP with boundless potential. As we approach launch, we are focusing on a team structure that will carry us to a successful release and beyond. Our strong and mighty team is building this IP from the ground up, pouring our hearts and souls into characters, worlds, and story.
Team culture is paramount as we cultivate an environment where creators thrive together. Support, growth, communication, collaborating and facing challenges together are vital in our success.   
We approach interdisciplinary collaboration the same way. We have thriving relationships with departments across the studio. Storytelling is not siloed, but rather integrated in all aspects of design and development, with experts across the studio participating in the creation of a narrative that works best for the game we’re all making together.
We’re looking for a leader who shares these values and wants to help our department and studio grow.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Lead the Narrative Design Department

Direct report of Narrative Designers and writers report up to you, so you’ll touch base daily:

Responsible for direct reports of Narrative Designers and Writers.
Recognize the strengths of team members and delegate tasks appropriately
Give direction and supply needed understanding and tools for success
Be aware of the status of tasks, progress, and blockers
Review all work coming in and respond in a timely fashion
Guide revisions to ensure all work is aligned and of a high quality
Instill confidence and ownership
Mentor the team and foster a healthy creative environment
Evaluate performance concerns and career goals with team members

Lead team meetings for the narrative development of new characters, personality/VO, narrative wrappers, and worlds

Attend interdisciplinary meetings and collaborate

Recognize narrative’s needs as well as other departments’ needs
Find creative ways to express the narrative and IP in given constraints
Represent the narrative team’s goals and ability to tackle tasks in a given timeline
Arbitrate effectively in the face of conflict
Communicate narrative process and ideas in language that is intuitive and accessible

Work with Director and Production team to establish realistic goals, milestones, and schedules

Establish workflows that cross interdisciplinary teams
Forecast milestone progress, and adjust processes to meet deadlines
Ensure that the scope of the work is appropriate for the team
Prioritize tasks according to studio and big-picture needs
Troubleshoot almost any issue that crops up in the department
Be proactive in the face of problems or issues - lead the solution efforts
Gather requirements for new or evolving features and help set up workflow pipelines 

Work with the Narrative/IP Director to ensure the Narrative Design department is aligned with larger IP/Narrative Goals

Meet on a regular basis to plan high-level narrative goals
Incorporate high level goals into the team’s plans and structure
Always keep lines of communication open to ensure the progress is aligned
Bring lingering concerns, questions, and/or blockers from the team to the director


QUALIFICATIONS

6+ years experience in lead capacity
At least 5 years writing experience in gaming, including dialogue/VO, character profiles, worldbuilding, cinematics, spec docs, pitches
Preferred 2+ years experience in multiplayer games
Experience in Unreal
Proven work in creating design documentation and maintaining creative direction
Strong understanding of the daily ebb and flow of game development
Experience communicating a game vision to teams and partners
Experience in all production phases from Concept to Live Operations, having shipped at least one title
Care deeply about creating and fostering healthy and strong teams
Demonstrate the ability to show empathy and emotional intelligence in the workplace
Displayed the ability to move between long range thinking and day to day issues
Experience in problem solving across multiple disciplines

Voluntary Self-Identification

Our vision at PlayStation is to bring out the best in our global team members by creating a sense of belonging, being a place where they can grow, and ensuring everyone feels valued, heard, and supported so we can push the boundaries of play. That vision begins our candidates, and we are working to better understand the diversity of our candidate population.  
 
This data will also be aggregated and sent to the government for reporting purposes. Please know that the completion of this form is entirely voluntary. Your personally identifiable information (name, address, etc) will not be considered in the hiring process or thereafter. Any information that you choose to provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file for XX time.

 

Protected Veteran

You are a “protected veteran” under United States law if any of the following apply to you:

  • Disabled Veteran: a veteran of the U.S. military who is entitled to compensation (or who would be entitled to compensation if not for the receipt of military retired pay) under the administration of the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and/or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability. 
  • Recently Separated Veteran: a veteran who has discharged or released from active duty in the U.S. military within the last three years.
  • Armed Forces Service Medal Veteran: a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, participated in a U.S. military operation for which an Armed Forces Service Medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.

 

Disability

Under U.S. law, you are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition.

Identifying yourself as an individual with a disability is voluntary, and we hope that you will choose to do so. Your answer will be maintained confidentially and will not be seen by selecting officials or anyone else involved in making personnel decisions, nor will it be shared with our accommodations team . Completing the form will not negatively impact you in any way, regardless of whether you have self-identified in the past.
